result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Brandon D Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kershek provides an update; he has most of the discovery but is still waiting on some digital discovery.  Atty. Kershek requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:39 AM Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Brandon D Willis.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. This case is tagging along with the defendant's other matters. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon D Willis
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 4126 W Kaul Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/Franciscan Woods listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

3:59 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Brandon D Willis in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Brandon D Willis. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:50 AM Defendant Brandon D Willis not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $500.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 3.
Initial appearance on July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
